text:
The former Union Minister Manish Tewari, from whose remarks on 2012 troop movement the Congress had distanced itself over a fortnight ago, was on Thursday made spokesperson of the party. “Congress president Sonia Gandhi has approved the appointment of Mr. Manish Tewari as spokesperson of the All India Congress Committee,” S.V. Ramani, Secretary of the AICC’s Communication department, said.

Only on January 10, the AICC had trashed a statement of Mr. Tewari, who had asserted that a news report on troop movement was “unfortunate but true.”

A former Information and Broadcasting Minister in UPA-II, Mr. Tewari was acting chairperson of the party's Media department during the last Lok Sabha elections. — PTI
title: Manish Tewari appointed Cong. spokesperson
